summary:
Internationally oriented, highly motivated manager with professional experience in Sales Operations & Support and Customer Service.  

I design, implement and improve processes that are in line with your companies’ vision and mission and at the same time I set up a coherent team working efficient and effective, taking into account each individuals’ talents and needs. I facilitate and stimulate the development of employees, coaching them to work independently and simultaneously I create an environment in your organisation with a great team spirit in which people feel appreciated.  I have experience with participating in many interdepartemental project groups giving my input as sales operations expert, varying from change management, ERP implementation to complaint management. I also used my expertise to optimise processes; for example in bringing down the average quotation lead time with almost 80% and I have successfully set up various service desks at other departments such as procurement and supply chain. 

I am energetic, positive, reliable, creative, customer focussed, strategic, analytical, communicative and with execution power. 

Specialties: Managing cross-cultural teams, Multilingual, Performance measurement, Management Reporting, Business Process Management & Re-design, Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), Service Level Agreements (SLA), Key Performance Indicators (KPI)

You can contact me by phone +31 (0) 6244 12345 or by email markjjoud@gmail.com

projects.title: ERP implementation
projects.description: Acting as representative of the Sales Department I was part of the project team, contributing to the Process Design & Architecture Document (PDAD), which is a blueprint for the functional needs. Following on this, the Functional Design Documents (FDD) were created, in which all elements of the PDAD were taken and broken down in further detail. The FDD provided a starting point for the creation of the Technical Design Document (TDD).

projects.title: Quotation optimisation
projects.description: I was Project Manager and the overall goal was to create a rapid quotation process which would lead to an improved hit rate, lower operational costs and a huge reduction of communication with both suppliers as internally. After investigating the causes which affected the quotation lead time I came up with solutions together with the departments involved; Sales, Purchase, Logistics and Finance. I made Service Level Agreements and Key Performance Indicators for each department and I created management information tools. By simplified and automatised processes and by installing Service Desks at both Purchase and Logistic departments, I had been able to bring down the average quotation lead time by almost 80% within three months.

contributors.headline: Manager Sales Operations
ERP Implementation Manager at Succes Schoonmaak
Procurement Specialist | USAID | GHSC - PSM
Executive Buyer Pharma at IDA TRADING FOUNDATION PVT. LTD>

projects.title: Fortify - Business Process Redesign
projects.description:
Under supervision of external consultant Frits Voortman we started this project in order to create the most efficient processes as possible before “pouring them into concrete” in a new ERP system. At each department a specialist was appointed to be part of the project team. I was representing the Sales Department.

The highlights of the project were:

- to assess and optimise current processes
- to create added value for customers
- efficiency in the supply chain ready for the future

In order to maximise the effect four phases were planned. These four phases strengthened each other and delivered a holistic view on the processes organisation and management information with a maximum of potential savings, and total integration of change management.

In phase one “Make strategy explicit” the management defined a competitive strategy. The processes with improvement potential were defined, changes were pointed out and the critical success factors were listed.

In phase two the organisation was looked upon “from the moon”: the existing business scenarios were investigated by flow of goods, money and documents/information.

In phase three the project team zoomed in on the business integration scenarios by checking out all end to end processes & documents. We analysed them and made simplified processes with reduction of time and reports.

The last and fourth phase was to asses all processes in all their steps with the question in mind “is an activity adding value for the customer?“ In this last phase the processes of phase three were broken up into activities, skipping non-contributing process steps and introducing value adding steps.

courses.name: Managing the company of the future

profile_positions.description: Within customer fulfilment I am managing a team of shop logistics specialists responsible for the day-to-day order to cash activities and instore logistic processes for retail worldwide. In supply chain we act as the voice of the customer  for retail, currently over 750 shops, both company stores and franchise stores and aim for the best customer experience. I am in charge of order & delivery schedules with focus on new store openings & relocations, product launches, promotions, event and seasonal peaks. Moreover I am responsible for an optimal retail load balance for warehouse capacity management and I take care of the reverse logistics processes. Whilst measuring, analyzing and reporting set KPI's,  I am continuously looking for improvements of shop logistics processes.
profile_positions.title: Manager Shop Logistics

profile_positions.description: I managed a team of customer service professionals for the business units Advanced Surgical Devices & Advanced Wound Management with headcount in line with opportunities and budget. I had the responsibility for managing the day-to-day order to cash activities ranging from order entry, order management until final delivery to the customer, including loan equipment, complaint management, returns & repairs, billing and dispute management. I was in charge of reviewing and renewing Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), created Key performance Indicators (KPI) and I established Service Level Agreements (SLA) between the various internal departments and third parties. I was as well engaged in having all working instructions in place for my own department, working closely together with other Customer Service Managers across the region applying best practices. Furthermore I was part of various interdepartmental and international meeting structures in sales operations, customer excellence, finance operations, S&OP and compliance and I was responsible for reporting and analysing sales order, back order and cost overviews.
profile_positions.title: Manager Customer Service

profile_positions.description:
I managed team leaders and had responsibility for the daily sales operations activities for three different teams with staff levels varying according to budget. I was responsible for creating and implementing Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for the Sales Operations team and establishing Service Level Agreements (SLA) between the different internal departments. I was in charge of managing full lead times from request for quotation until final delivery to the customer, making process improvements, solving problems and taking corrective actions and applying the international standards set by WHO and Global Fund. I was responsible for the business processes managing several cross functional projects, developing, modifying and providing input to project plans such as:

1.	Change Management: reorganisation of the whole company
2.	ERP implementation
3.	Quoting optimisation
4.	Deliveries IFOT (in full on time)
5.     Complaint Management
profile_positions.title: Manager Sales Operations

profile_positions.description:
Managing Sales Operations teams for three different business units:

1.	Wholesale team 2009 -2010
2.	NGO team 2008 - 2009
3.	Africa team 2006 – 2008

I managed the end-to-end process of quoting, tendering, and order processing and was the first point of contact for escalations. Furthermore I made sure that team members were working according to set SOP’s, SLA’s and international standards by extensive training, coaching and organising several interdepartmental workshops. I was also recruiting staff and executing performance measurement.
profile_positions.title: Team leader

profile_positions.description: Primary contact for Key accounts in the African region. I was responsible for sales including tender activities and operations for the complete supply chain of medicines and medical supplies until final destination in my area. I initiated and implemented the process of supplying directly from manufacturers to customers. The main focus area were the three big diseases - Aids, Malaria and Tuberculosis – and I worked in close cooperation with Ministries of Health, Central Medical stores, local NGO’s and IDA’s Agents network. Within less than two years I more than doubled the annual turnover in my area.
profile_positions.title: International Account Manager

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the sales of custom-made sales promotion items for large blue chip companies, managing as well the supply chain of the design, sourcing, procurement and production.
profile_positions.title: International Trader

profile_positions.description: Account manager responsible for sales of sales promotion items for customers based in the Benelux, France, Spain, Portugal, Hungary and Poland. Within less than two years I had been able to generate 50% of the total annual turnover. I was also in charge of coordinating the daily sales operations activities of the sales team.
profile_positions.title: International Account Manager

profile_positions.description: Evaluating the eligibility for loans and insurances for prospective pilots. I was monitoring the study results on a continuous basis and worked in close cooperation with flight academies and airlines.
profile_positions.title: Financial Advisor
